template.name: Enhanced SNMP Interface Discovery
template.description:
Enhanced SNMP interface discovery 1.0.1 Template made by Twan Kamans. https://www.twan-it.nl
This template searches for 4 different categories: - Interfaces that are administratively disabled - Interfaces that are working onder normal condition - Interfaces with priority, such as switch uplink - Virtual interfaces such as tunnel, port channel and vlan interfaces.
Revision 0.7 - Added support for virtual interfaces Revision 0.7.1 - Added support for (filtering) stack switch ports - Fixed a bug in which VLAN interfaces with the number 0 in them would still be discovered by the normal LLD rule Revision 0.7.2 - Filtering VLAN's 1002 - 1005 interfaces - Added support for subinterfaces for Junos Revision 0.8 - Completely revisited the filtering of items using Regex due to introduction of Junos devices. You can adjust the regex for physical devices using a macro. Revision 0.9 - Added support for enduser ports. Triggers will not activate if port description contains macro value. Revision 1.0 - Tested template on posible errors. Revision 1.0.1 - Added bandwidth statistics for virtual interfaces. Revision 1.0.2 - Bandwidth triggers now make use of user macro context, making individual port bandwidth limits posible. - The interface changed state severity has been lowered by default. The new default severity for all interfaces is "warning". Exceptions to this are the priority interfaces which are "average".

item.name: Total amount of interfaces
item.description: Shows the total amount of interfaces.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface status has changed on port {#IFNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when the interface state changes.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Bandwidth usage over {$INT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING:"{#IFNAME}"}%
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when incoming or outgoing traffic exceeds limit of the INT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING macro.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when incoming or outgoing errors exceeds limit of the INT_ERRORS_WARN macro.

trigger_prototype.name: Port {#IFNAME} is enabled but not connected!
trigger_prototype.description: Zabbix detects a "notconnected" port on {HOST.NAME} Interface {#IFNAME}.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Admin status
item_prototype.description: Shows if interface is administrative disabled.

trigger_prototype.name: Port {#IFNAME} has gone UP!
trigger_prototype.description: Interface state has changed. This is most likely due to enabeling an interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface status has changed on host {HOST.NAME} port {#IFNAME}: {#SNMPVALUE}
Interface {#IFNAME}: Bandwidth usage over {$INT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING:"{#IFNAME}"}%
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when incoming or outgoing traffic exceeds limit of the INT_BANDWIDTH_WARNING macro.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface status has changed on port {#IFNAME}
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when the interface state changes.
